image.altText: swimmers cool off at coogee beach side pool during a hot sydney day

props.synopsis: New South Wales is on high bushfire alert, with hot and gusty winds forecast for parts of the state on Sunday.

title.children: Greater Sydney among nine regions across NSW under total fire ban

image.altText: A soldier stands on the street surrounded by debris from protest.

props.synopsis: The United States urges Belgrade to pull its forces back from the border with Kosovo after detecting what it called an "unprecedented" Serbian military build-up.

title.children: US warns of large Serbian military build-up near Kosovo

image.altText: Colourful pencils on a desk in a childcare centre.

props.synopsis: Australian parents facing crippling cost-of-living pressures are paying almost twice the OECD average for child care, an ACCC inquiry finds, with the system also failing to deliver for low-income families and those in the bush.

title.children: Australia’s for profit childcare system favours the wealthy and needs a major re-design: ACCC

image.altText: Ezra Mam is hit

props.synopsis: Everything you need to know as the Penrith Panthers take on the Brisbane Broncos in the NRL grand final, and the Newcastle Knights look to go back-to-back as NRLW premiers when they meet the Gold Coast Titans in the women's decider.

title.children: What time does the NRL grand final kick off tonight? Where can I watch it?

image.altText: Jim Chalmers and Anthony Albanese walk in a court yard at parliament house with coffees

props.synopsis: The government has a new definition of full employment, but will it make any difference, asks Gareth Hutchens.

title.children: Is the Albanese government's vision of full employment a flop?

image.altText: A man in green clothes on the left shakes hands with a man in a blue suit on the right

props.synopsis: Defence Secretary Grant Shapps tells British media there was scope to offer military training within Ukraine.

title.children: UK aims to offer military training inside Ukraine, defence secretary says

image.altText: A white man in a suit stands and gestures at a us government podium

props.synopsis: The 11th-hour deal comes after Republican speaker Kevin McCarthy defies hardliners in his own party.

title.children: US government poised to avoid shutdown with 45-day stopgap bill hours before funding expires

image.altText: Scott Pendlebury stands on the fence and holds the cup aloft in front of Magpies fans

props.synopsis: Hating Collingwood is in the blood of so many footy fans, but if you were ever able to take a step back and admire the Magpies' journey you were treated to something truly special.

title.children: You may never let yourself love Collingwood, but this special Magpies team deserves your respect

image.altText: A young white woman in a wheelchair out on the street

props.synopsis: The role of special schools is again in the spotlight, with the disability royal commission recommending segregated education be phased out.

title.children: Australia has long been divided on 'special schools'. Now the disability royal commission is too

image.altText: A composite image of a man walking in the rain, of a sunset, and of rain falling over a bay.

props.synopsis: From record-breaking spring heat over south-eastern Australia to flooding rains in Greece and Spain, the jet stream has had a lot to answer for recently. Here's what it is and how it works.

title.children: 'Arguably the greatest weather systems on Earth': How the jet stream has been driving extreme weather

image.altText: A woman in traditional Uyghur garb poses for a photo

props.synopsis: For several years, the region of Xinjiang has been shut off from most of the world's media. The ABC got to go inside, but all was not as it seemed.

title.children: China gave the ABC a tightly controlled tour of Xinjiang. Here's what we saw

image.altText: A mum laying in a hospital bed in blue hospital robes feeding a bottle of milk to a baby

props.synopsis: While there is no cure for breast cancer, experts say medical advances are allowing patients to live longer and enjoy a better quality of life.

title.children: Diagnosed with breast cancer at 33, Elysia is pinning her hopes on a drug so new, it doesn't have a name

image.altText: Distraught Brisbane Lions players stand and sit on the ground at the MCG after the end of the grand final.

props.synopsis: There is no dishonour for the Brisbane Lions in losing one of the great grand finals, but there are no guarantees in football. So, where to now for the team and coach Chris Fagan?

title.children: Brisbane Lions at the crossroads after grand final heartbreak

image.altText: Two police officers bend examining a road cordoned off with police tape with a police car parked at the back of the shot.

props.synopsis: The Major Collision Investigation Unit is investigating the death in a Blackburn North car park.

title.children: Child dies after being hit by a car near Melbourne church

image.altText: McIlroy

props.synopsis: Rory McIlroy explodes into a heated argument at the Ryder Cup, after claiming an opponent's caddie was waving his hat during a crucial putt.

title.children: Explosive scenes at the Ryder Cup as McIlroy accuses opponent's caddie of unfair play

image.altText: A military helicopter lands in bushland, kicking up clouds of dust.

props.synopsis: About 400 Australian aerospace support workers are facing redundancy after a fleet of MRH90 Taipan helicopters has been retired early, the head of the European manufacturer says.

title.children: Retiring Australia's Taipan helicopters will cost 400 local jobs, manufacturer says

image.altText: Two people stand in kitchen of house missing wall

props.synopsis: In 1990 a Japanese-language film made in Tasmania was released in Japan. Called Tasmania Story, it became a multi-million-dollar box office hit that fuelled tourism and trade opportunities.

title.children: Film set for box office hit Tasmania Story still stands, but only just after vandals and neglect take toll

image.altText: A brown bear hunts for salmon, before winter hibernation, in a river.

props.synopsis: They are big, round, fluffy and want your vote. Here is everything you need to know about Fat Bear Week.

title.children: Bigger is better as voters get ready for Fat Bear Week

image.altText: A roll of barbed wire atop a prison wall at night.

props.synopsis: Western Australia's problem-plagued Banksia Hill Youth Detention Centre features heavily throughout the eighth volume of the Royal Commission into Violence, Abuse, Neglect and Exploitation of People with Disability report.

title.children: Banksia Hill youth detention centre woes consume entire chapter of disability royal commission report

image.altText: Htadalo Vakie and Emma Koitche hold up  the cultural flag of the Kanak community.

props.synopsis: With work underway to update New Caledonia's unique way of grappling with its colonial history, pro-independence Kanak leaders reflect on the gains made and the path ahead for the French territory.

title.children: 'Masters of our own destiny’: New Caledonia negotiates new future as Nouméa Accord lapses

image.altText: composite image of jennifer cownie and maggie zhou

props.synopsis: Being busy has become the symbol of modern life. And for many, living a fast-paced lifestyle is aspirational.

title.children: 'Not everyone wants to be busy': Why the 'snail girl era' resonates

image.altText: A crocodile and a Chinook helicopter.

props.synopsis: Crocs at a Rockhampton reptile farm were flung into the throes of orgiastic ecstasy after a Chinook helicopter hovered low over their pools – and the erotic explosion has researchers very interested.

title.children: Croc sex frenzy: Low-flying army choppers spark romp in the swamp

image.altText: A black and white historical photo of a group of students with their teacher

props.synopsis: Yallourn was built to house workers in Victoria's State Electricity Commission. It was dug up so the coal underneath could be mined.

title.children: Locals still fondly remember Yallourn, the 'garden city' dug up for coal

image.altText: Sophie Turner and Joe Jonas attend the gala

props.synopsis: As the messy break-up between Sophie Turner and Joe Jonas plays out in full view of the public, social media is exposing the radically shifting power dynamics of the celebrity divorce industrial complex.

title.children: Joe Jonas, Sophie Turner and the shifting dynamics of the celebrity divorce industrial complex

image.altText: A boy holding a painted surfboard with the ocean behind him.

props.synopsis: Offshore wind zones are being established right around Australia, but some communities say there are too many unknown risks.

title.children: Offshore wind touted as possible energy solution, but some young Aussies don’t want them in their backyard

image.altText: A man dives through the air before scoring a try.

props.synopsis: Australia's World Cup hopes remain alive after Fiji fails to secure a bonus point in their victory over Georgia.

title.children: Wallabies still alive at Rugby World Cup as Fiji scrapes home against Georgia

image.altText: Collingwood coach Craig McRae pumps his right fist after winning the AFL grand final.

props.synopsis: As the Magpies celebrated their epic premiership victory, Craig McRae announced to the massive MCG crowd his wife has given birth to a baby girl.

title.children: 'Best day of my life': Magpies coach reveals stunning family news during euphoria of grand final win

image.altText: nsw police and paremedics attend to two fishermen whose boat was struck by a whale at la perouse in sydney

props.synopsis: A man has died and another is in hospital after a "tragic accident" with a whale at Sydney's Botany Bay. Police say the skipper of the boat, Darren Curmin, tried to keep the dead man afloat until police arrived.

title.children: Man dies after boat hits whale off NSW coast

image.altText: Ken, on the left, and Louis, on the right, wearing white clothes covered in bright colours after doing a colour run

props.synopsis: When Ken turned 94 in July, there was one birthday card that stood out to him — it was written by a teenager he met in a social experiment who he now counts as a close friend.

title.children: Despite a 78-year age gap, Ken and Louis connected over their shared grief. Now they're firm friends
